text: Your weekend gets unexpectedly free. What do you do?

options.text: Sketch a quick plan: reservations, exhibit, dinner, cocktails.
Grab a backpack and chase whatever sounds fun—no itinerary.
Text friends/family and organize something everyone enjoys.
Find a weird pop-up/underground show nobody’s heard of.

text: You pick the perfect entree from the menu. The waiter says they're out. What do you do?

options.text: Ask for the closest alternative and pick the nearest match.
Tell them to surprise you or choose something you’ve never tried.
Check what your table is getting and pivot so you can share.
Ask about off-menu options or customize something unusual.

text: You find a wallet full of cash on the subway platform. What do you do?

options.text: Hand it to the station agent; leave your contact.
Call the first ID/number and return it immediately.
Ask nearby riders; wait a few minutes, then pocket the cash and leave.
Drop at nearest precinct and post a quick 'found' note.

text: Which statement feels most like you right now?

options.text: I’m disciplined; I like dependable results.
I chase energy; I’ll trade polish for excitement.
I’m about connection; if others are happy, I’m happy.
I want something with character—even if it’s polarizing.
